channel.title: Would this laptop run runescape in medium graphics?
channel.description:
Would this laptop run runescape in low - high detail
and if it can how many bots can it run?
http://www.pcworld.co.uk/gbuk/hp-pavilion-g6-1296sa-15-6-laptop-red-11290975-pdt.html

item.title: Would this laptop run runescape in medium graphics?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Solitaire, post:35, topic:426306”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=528999.msg3859321#msg3859321 date=1324580773]

Dunno i missed it

http://www.pcworld.co.uk/gbuk/hp-pavilion-g6-1296sa-15-6-laptop-red-11290975-pdt.html

What pc games am i able to play with this?

No real modern games like battlefield, cod, skyrim etc. You’ll be spending over £600 at least to do that with medium settings (like my baby ).
[/quote]

Well the original price of the laptop was £650 would it not run

call of duty 4
or black ops on low settings[/quote]
That’s all lies to entice you in, that is no way worth £650 and it never should of been. Mine was £699 and that was 2 years ago, and she runs battlefield 3 on medium settings, have you seen them visuals? And technology has become ever more powerful and cheaper since then (bar hdds at the present, but we all know why that is).

It will not run black ops on low @ 30fps, you may struggle with cod4 on low @ about 20fps if you’re lucky.

Here, got a few recommendations, from best to worst:

http://www.pcworld.co.uk/gbuk/hp-pavilion-dv6-6052ea-refurbished-15-6-laptop-dark-umber-11102593-pdt.html - £529.00
This is the highest spec of the ones I found in the refurbished section, don’t worry they’re practically brand new, my friend bought one.
You’ll be expecting to run black ops on HIGH @ 32fps~ which is smooth, and LOW @ 80fps~.

http://www.pcworld.co.uk/gbuk/hp-pavilion-dv6-3130sa-refurbished-15-6-laptop-silver-08527246-pdt.html - £429.00
Medium spec, actually not a huge amount of difference between this and the first one, the main difference being the one above has the newest generation of Core i processors.
Black ops on HIGH @ 20fps~, LOW @ 65fps~

http://www.pcworld.co.uk/gbuk/hp-pavilion-g6-1014sa-refurbished-15-6-laptop-charcoal-grey-10934189-pdt.html - £359.00
Cheapest of the 3, partially due to it using an AMD processor, tend to be a little cheaper.
The card will do black ops on HIGH @ uhh, 5fps~ lol, but she will manage about 40fps~ on LOW.

Take your pick, just recommendations, I’d probably go for the middle one definitely if you’re on a tight budget.

Oh, just read that you’ve already bought it, fml, that took ages…

Read full topic
item.source: Would this laptop run runescape in medium graphics?

item.title: Would this laptop run runescape in medium graphics?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Solitaire, post:37, topic:426306”][quote author=Frell link=topic=528999.msg3859340#msg3859340 date=1324581558]
My microwave can max rs settings
[/quote]

Lol my pc can barly run at low thats why i got a laptop =P[/quote]

Just know that because it’s a laptop, it’s inherently more expensive than the equivalent specs on a tower, and much harder to interchange parts.

Read full topic
item.source: Would this laptop run runescape in medium graphics?

item.title: Would this laptop run runescape in medium graphics?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:21, topic:426306”][quote author=lowbrow link=topic=528999.msg3859230#msg3859230 date=1324575020]
My windows 3.1 can run Runescape in HD

Two things are most important when buying a computer for gaming and Stability.
The Processor and the Graphics Card, next comes the Memory and the Disk Space.
Then the cooling/heat ratio, and finally the chassis and misc. items.
[/quote]

Not really. You need a good balance between processors and RAM. And for processors, it’s not just the frequency that matters. You need to look at how big the caches are, how many cores it has, hyperthreading, architecture (whether 32bit or 64bit), boost/overclocking capabilities, etc. You need to check RAM types and speeds. For graphics cards, you aren’t going to get anything that great in a laptop anyway, unless you buy a total powerhouse (but why would you? just buy a desktop and save a ton of money).

Disk space isn’t really important anymore either. Disk speed is really important, especially if you want to have large amounts of virtual memory without slowing down fast RAM or a fast processor.[/quote]
hence why i still run windows 3.1

Read full topic

item.title: Would this laptop run runescape in medium graphics?
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“Solitaire, post:26, topic:426306”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=528999.msg3859264#msg3859264 date=1324578072]

Solitaire, bots have been down for nearly 2 months now… None of them work…

I c havent botted in a while and why are they down?

RuneScape

Bot-Nuking Day: Making RuneScape Fairer and More Fun!

To celebrate Bot-Nuking Day - the biggest bot-busting initiative in RuneScape history � we are running a series of bonus events this week which will be fairer and more fun for everyone. As well as the bot-busting update we will introduce a brace of...

RuneScape

Bot-Busting and Bonuses For All

Today, I am really happy to say we are in the long-awaited position of being able to announce that we�ll be launching our most formidable bot-busting weapon in our history, targeting what we believe to be 98% of the bots seen in game.

Thats a shame oh well ill just bot when they come back

They most likely won’t…
[/quote]

powerbot announcent that they will be back by 16th jan[/quote]

Bet you a thousand dollars they won’t

Read full topic

item.title: Would this laptop run runescape in medium graphics?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“lowbrow, post:18, topic:426306”]My windows 3.1 can run Runescape in HD

Two things are most important when buying a computer for gaming and Stability.
The Processor and the Graphics Card, next comes the Memory and the Disk Space.
Then the cooling/heat ratio, and finally the chassis and misc. items.[/quote]

Not really. You need a good balance between processors and RAM. And for processors, it’s not just the frequency that matters. You need to look at how big the caches are, how many cores it has, hyperthreading, architecture (whether 32bit or 64bit), boost/overclocking capabilities, etc. You need to check RAM types and speeds. For graphics cards, you aren’t going to get anything that great in a laptop anyway, unless you buy a total powerhouse (but why would you? just buy a desktop and save a ton of money).

Disk space isn’t really important anymore either. Disk speed is really important, especially if you want to have large amounts of virtual memory without slowing down fast RAM or a fast processor.
